title: International Criminal Court (ICC)
description: Learn about the mission and functions of the International Criminal Court

questions.question: What is the mission of the ICC?
questions.answer: The mission of the ICC is to hold accountable people responsible for the worst crimes globally.

questions.question: What was the goal behind creating the ICC?
questions.answer: The goal was to create a permanent and efficient court for trying global crimes.

questions.question: How many judges does the ICC have?
How does the ICC handle apprehending suspects?
questions.answer: The ICC relies completely on member countries to apprehend suspects since they don't have a police force of their own.

questions.question: What is the difference between the ICC and the ICJ?
questions.answer: The ICC prosecutes criminals, while the ICJ settles disputes between States.

questions.question: Can the ICC open cases on nonmember countries?
questions.answer: In some events, the ICC can open cases on nonmember countries.
